alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 9:37AM EST until January 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Singac...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.8 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EST Wednesday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.3 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 05/04/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 8.8 Wed 8 am 7.9 7.1 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
